title: Russia Is Arming Drones With North Korean Cluster Weapons, Report Says
summary: Though Pyongyang has largely pulled its soldiers off the front lines in Ukraine, it is expanding the types of ammunition it supplies to Russia.

title: FEMA Cuts Disaster Aid, Leaving States Fending for Themselves
summary: President Trump has said he wants to eventually shift the burden of disaster relief and recovery onto states. It’s already happening.

title: Judge Says Immigration Agents Must Wear Body Cameras in Chicago
summary: The federal judge said she was “profoundly concerned” that federal agents might have violated earlier limits that she had set as the Trump administration has carried out an immigration crackdown.

title: Venture Capitalist Resigns From Salesforce Foundation Over Benioff Comments
summary: Ron Conway stepped down from the board of Salesforce’s philanthropic arm after the company’s chief executive, Marc Benioff, said he supported President Trump and wanted the National Guard to come to San Francisco.

title: Harvard’s Wealth Is Growing, Despite Trump’s Attacks on Its Funds
summary: In its latest financial report, Harvard said its endowment grew even bigger in the last fiscal year. But it still faces financial problems because of federal cuts.

summary: Zohran Mamdani, Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa will meet onstage  at 7 p.m. for the first of two general election debates.

title: Ben Stiller Honors His Parents In ‘Stiller & Meara: Nothing Is Lost’
summary: How to lead an artistic life and be part of a family is a tension he has only recently faced in life and now, onscreen, for a film about his comedian parents.

title: She Self-Deported. Now She and Other Crime Survivors Are Suing ICE.
summary: Lawyers argue that the agency’s new policies have led to the detention and removal of victims of domestic violence and trafficking, despite their legal protections.

summary: For decades, the United States tried to push undocumented people to self-deport, but success has often depended on coercion.

summary: For Jon Ossoff, the most endangered Senate Democrat, the shutdown fight could rally support among some voters, but risks alienating others in a state President Trump won in 2024.

title: Judge Temporarily Blocks Trump From Firing Government Workers During Shutdown
summary: Labor groups are set to square off against the Trump administration one day after the president renewed his threat to cut “Democrat programs.”

title: Solution to CIA’s Kryptos Sculpture Is Found in Smithsonian Vault
summary: Jim Sanborn is auctioning off the solution to Kryptos, the puzzle he sculpted for the intelligence agency’s headquarters. Two fans of the work then discovered the key.

summary: Ceremonies took place on Thursday to commemorate two years since the surprise attack of Oct. 7, 2023, on southern Israel.

title: Where Does the Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Stand?
summary: Unresolved issues — mainly over the exchange of hostage and prisoner remains — threaten to destabilize the fragile agreement.

title: Yemen’s Houthis Confirm Killing of Top Military Official
summary: It was unclear when Maj. Gen. Mohammed al-Ghomari was killed, or by whom, but Israel appeared to claim the killing.

summary: Carnegie Hall was a site of protest on Wednesday, one of many demonstrations over the last two years targeting cultural events, particularly those with Israeli artists.

title: Delta and United Are Leaving Other Airlines Behind
summary: Delta Air Lines and United Airlines have accounted for most of the industry’s profits since 2022. Their appeal to wealthy travelers could become a liability if the economy weakens.

title: High-End Amenities in Office Buildings? These N.Y. Tenants Say No Thanks.
summary: Leasing activity for older buildings, hit hard during the pandemic, is gaining momentum, a strong indicator that the overall office market in Manhattan is on the upswing.

title: Renting a San Francisco Apartment in the A.I. Boom? Good Luck.
summary: The artificial intelligence gold rush has pushed San Francisco’s residential rents up by the most in the nation, as A.I. companies lease apartments and offer rent stipends to employees.

summary: The Supreme Court justice isn’t making decisions based on public opinion.

title: Early Rains Tame California’s Peak Wildfire Season
summary: Recent rain significantly reduced the risk of a large fire breaking out before year’s end, experts said.

title: New Oklahoma Superintendent Rescinds Bible Mandate
summary: The superintendent said he had “no plans” to enforce his predecessor’s mandate to put Bibles in public school classrooms, which was being fought in court.

title: Ten Inmates Escaped From a New Orleans Jail. Derrick Groves Stood Out.
summary: In May, 10 inmates escaped from a jail in New Orleans, highlighting the facility’s chronic problems. Derrick Groves was at large for months.

title: World Meteorological Report Marks Biggest Annual Jump in CO2 Levels
summary: Surging emissions from wildfires may have been behind the increase, which was the largest since modern measurements began more than half a century ago.
